wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Sir Luke O'Connor,  (20 January 1831 – 1 February 1915) was an Irish soldier who served in the British Army. He was the first soldier to receive the Victoria Cross, Britain's highest award for gallantry in the face of the enemy.

response: * Colour-Sergeant Luke O'Connor, Crimean War (20 September 1854)
*1914–1915: Maj-Gen. Sir Luke O'Connor, VC, KCB
*Luke O'Connor (1831–1915), first soldier to receive the Victoria Cross, born in Hillstreet, near Elphin
